tags.name: str-badge
tags.readme:
# Badge

The Badge (str-badge) is inline block element uses for notification of how many items associated with another element.
tags.description: The Badge (str-badge) is inline block element uses for notification of how many items associated with another element.

usage.angular:
```html
<!-- Default -->
<str-badge>99</str-badge>

<!-- Colors -->
<str-badge color="primary">11</str-badge>
<str-badge color="secondary">22</str-badge>
<str-badge color="tertiary">33</str-badge>
<str-badge color="success">44</str-badge>
<str-badge color="warning">55</str-badge>
<str-badge color="danger">66</str-badge>
<str-badge color="light">77</str-badge>
<str-badge color="medium">88</str-badge>
<str-badge color="dark">99</str-badge>

<!-- Button with badge on left and right -->
<str-button>
  <str-badge slot="start">11</str-badge>
  <str-label>My Button</str-label>
  <str-badge slot="end">22</str-badge>
</str-item>
```
usage.javascript:
```html
<!-- Default -->
<str-badge>99</str-badge>

<!-- Colors -->
<str-badge color="primary">11</str-badge>
<str-badge color="secondary">22</str-badge>
<str-badge color="tertiary">33</str-badge>
<str-badge color="success">44</str-badge>
<str-badge color="warning">55</str-badge>
<str-badge color="danger">66</str-badge>
<str-badge color="light">77</str-badge>
<str-badge color="medium">88</str-badge>
<str-badge color="dark">99</str-badge>

<!-- Button with badge on left and right -->
<str-button>
  <str-badge slot="start">11</str-badge>
  <str-label>My Button</str-label>
  <str-badge slot="end">22</str-badge>
</str-item>
```
usage.vue:
```html
<template>
  <!-- Default -->
  <str-badge>99</str-badge>

  <!-- Colors -->
  <str-badge color="primary">11</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="secondary">22</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="tertiary">33</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="success">44</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="warning">55</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="danger">66</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="light">77</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="medium">88</str-badge>
  <str-badge color="dark">99</str-badge>

  <!-- Button with badge on left and right -->
  <str-button>
    <str-badge slot="start">11</str-badge>
    <str-label>My Button</str-label>
    <str-badge slot="end">22</str-badge>
  </str-button>
</template>

<script>
import { StoriesBadge, StoriesButton, StoriesLabel } from '@str-js/vue';
import { defineComponent } from 'vue';

export default defineComponent({
  components: { StoriesBadge, StoriesButton, StoriesLabel }
});
</script>
```

properties.description: Set to true to draw the button with a caret for use with dropdowns, popovers, etc.

properties.description: Set to true to draw a circle button.

properties.name: disabled
properties.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.
properties.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.

properties.name: expand

Set to `"block"` for a full-width button or to `"full"` for a full-width button
without left and right borders.

tags.name: str-dropdown
tags.readme:
# Dropdown

The Dropdown (str-dropdown) displays drop-down box that enables selection of an option from an available list of values.
tags.description: The Dropdown (str-dropdown) displays drop-down box that enables selection of an option from an available list of values.

# Footer

The Footer (str-footer) is a root component, always appears at the bottom of the page.
tags.description: The Footer (str-footer) is a root component, always appears at the bottom of the page.

tags.name: str-grid
tags.readme:
# Grid

The Grid (str-grid) is a container designed on mobile-first flexbox system for building custom layouts. A layout based on a 12 columns by default, but could be easily customized to any number via CSS customization. Columns will expand to fill the row, and will resize to fit additional columns.
tags.description: The Grid (str-grid) is a container designed on mobile-first flexbox system for building custom layouts. A layout based on a 12 columns by default, but could be easily customized to any number via CSS customization. Columns will expand to fill the row, and will resize to fit additional columns.

tags.name: str-group
tags.readme:
# Group

The Group (str-group) is used to group multiple fields, usually checkboxes. It can be used for vertical (default) or horizontal organization of the fields that are supplied as its children.
tags.description: The Group (str-group) is used to group multiple fields, usually checkboxes. It can be used for vertical (default) or horizontal organization of the fields that are supplied as its children.

tags.name: str-icon
tags.readme:
# Icon

The Icon (str-icon) is an easy and performant way to use icons in your Stories application. It dynamically loads only visible SVG icons on demand. Icons should not be used for decoration.

tags.name: str-input
tags.readme:
# Input

The Input (str-input) component is a styled and enchanced HTML input element. It supports only standard text input events and types such as "text", "password", "email", "number", "search", "tel", and "url".
tags.description: The Input (str-input) component is a styled and enchanced HTML input element. It supports only standard text input events and types such as "text", "password", "email", "number", "search", "tel", and "url".

methods.name: typeToSelect
methods.docs:
Initiates type-to-select logic, which automatically selects an option based on what the user is currently typing.
The key passed will be appended to the internal query and the selection will be updated. After a brief period, the
internal query is cleared automatically. This method is intended to be used with the keydown event. Useful for
enabling type-to-select when the menu doesn't have focus.

properties.name: color
properties.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

properties.name: showCancelButton
properties.docs:
Sets the behavior for the cancel button. Defaults to `"never"`.
Setting to `"focus"` shows the cancel button on focus.
Setting to `"never"` hides the cancel button.
Setting to `"always"` shows the cancel button regardless
of focus state.

properties.name: showClearButton
properties.docs:
Sets the behavior for the clear button. Defaults to `"focus"`.
Setting to `"focus"` shows the clear button on focus if the
input is not empty.
Setting to `"never"` hides the clear button.
Setting to `"always"` shows the clear button regardless
of focus state, but only if the input is not empty.

tags.name: str-select
tags.readme:
# Select

The Select (str-select) displays a list or drop-down box that enables selection of an option or multiple options from an available list of values.
tags.description: The Select (str-select) displays a list or drop-down box that enables selection of an option or multiple options from an available list of values.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: - The select's options in the form of menu items.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: label - The select's label. Alternatively, you can use the label prop.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: help-text - Help text that describes how to use the select. Alternatively, you can use the help-text prop.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: invalid-text - Invalid text tells a user how to fix the error. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text prop.

properties.docs: Set to true to add a clear button when the select is populated.

properties.description: Set to true to disable the select control.

properties.description: The select's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

properties.description: The select's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

tags.name: str-sidebar

# Sidebar

The Sidebar (str-sidebar) displays collection of names of stories. Every story's name is the link your can click to navigate to story.
tags.description: The Sidebar (str-sidebar) displays collection of names of stories. Every story's name is the link your can click to navigate to story.

tags.name: str-tab
tags.readme:
# Tab

The Tab (str-tab) is a child component of a [str-tabs](../tabs). 

> Note: This component should only be used with vanilla or Stencil JavaScript projects. For Angular, React, and Vue apps you do not need to use `str-tab` to declare your tab components.

See the [str-tabs](../tabs) for configuration details.
tags.description:
The Tab (str-tab) is a child component of a [str-tabs](../tabs). 

> Note: This component should only be used with vanilla or Stencil JavaScript projects. For Angular, React, and Vue apps you do not need to use `str-tab` to declare your tab components.

See the [str-tabs](../tabs) for configuration details.

properties.name: tab
properties.docs:
A tab id must be provided for each `str-tab`. It's used internally to reference
the selected tab or by the router to switch between them.

tags.name: str-tab-bar
tags.readme:
#  Tabbar

The Tabbar (str-tab-bar) is a component that contains a set of [str-tab-button's](../tab-button). Put the str-tab-bar in the [str-tabs](../tabs) to organize communication with every [str-tab](../tab).

tags.name: str-tab-button
tags.readme:
# Tab button

The Tab button (str-tab-button) is a component that is placed inside of a [str-tab-bar](../tab-bar). You can change the layout of the text and icon in the tab bar.

See the [str-tabs](../tabs) documentation for details on configuring tabs.
tags.description:
The Tab button (str-tab-button) is a component that is placed inside of a [str-tab-bar](../tab-bar). You can change the layout of the text and icon in the tab bar.

See the [str-tabs](../tabs) documentation for details on configuring tabs.

It defaults to `'icon-start'`.

tags.name: str-tabs
tags.readme:
# Tabs

The Tabs (str-tabs) is a container works as a router outlet in order to handle navigation. It does not provide any UI feedback or mechanism to switch between tabs. In order to do so, an [str-tab-bar](../tab-bar) should be provided as a direct child of `str-tabs`.
tags.description: The Tabs (str-tabs) is a container works as a router outlet in order to handle navigation. It does not provide any UI feedback or mechanism to switch between tabs. In order to do so, an [str-tab-bar](../tab-bar) should be provided as a direct child of `str-tabs`.

tags.name: str-textarea
tags.readme:
# Textarea

The Textarea (str-textarea) can be used as an input with multiple lines of text.
tags.description: The Textarea (str-textarea) can be used as an input with multiple lines of text.

docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: help-text - Help text that describes how to use the textarea.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: invalid-text - Invalid text tells a user how to fix the error. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text prop.

properties.name: autocapitalize
properties.docs:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.
